title: Gamification-Based Personalized Instructional Design for Self-Directed Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational science theories and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Personalized science learning experiences utilizing VR simulations and gamification elements in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners enhance learning motivation for science topics by over 20% through the application of gamification elements.
Learners successfully complete over 80% of scientific problem-solving tasks presented in VR simulations.
Learners personalize three or more learning activities by selecting game elements aligned with their behavioral profiles (e.g., explorer, creator).
Learners achieve over 85% mastery in cognitive domain items (understanding–application–analysis) in formative assessments based on Bloom’s Taxonomy.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
